definition: paragraph/section/segment/stage (of a process)/classifier for stories, periods of time, lengths of thread etc

sentences.english: This is the stuff of Hollywood.
Just be yourself, and do what you like.
sentences.chinese: 雖然橋段很老套，不過還是很適合闔家歡樂的。

sentences.english: It seems like some climax of a romance movie… but too bad the other party is a female.
sentences.chinese: 看起來好像是愛情電影的橋段，可惜對象是女的。

sentences.english: This kind of contest is a very common literary device.
sentences.chinese: 這種較量是非常文學化的橋段。

sentences.english: These transcend the occasional passage in which MacLaverty tries too hard to see into the life and rhythms of a female artist.
sentences.chinese: 這些都是作者透過一個女性藝術家想要呈現的橋段。

sentences.english: Since it is impossible mission, why he try to do it ? Never quit , just do it. That's the point.
sentences.chinese: 幾乎沒有個橋段是用過的，阿湯哥的那個團隊真心贊。

sentences.english: The film that follows amounts to a prolonged bout of paranoid hysterics.
sentences.chinese: 之後影片便流向了漫長的歇斯底里橋段。

sentences.english: Everyone loves a good striptease in movies.
sentences.chinese: 每個人都喜歡電影中那些脫衣舞的經典橋段。

sentences.english: Other than the above ideas, I have also considered making movie goofs .
sentences.chinese: 除了自創的橋段外，還可以玩電影惡搞。

definition: script for play, opera, movie etc/screenplay/scenario
dialogue (in a movie or a play)
scene/tableau/picture/image/screen (displayed by a computer)/(motion picture) frame/field of view
theatrical work (play, opera, TV series etc)/dramatic (change, increase etc)/acute/severe
